search_information.query_displayed: Mother's Employment and Children's Achievement: A Critique. Heyns, Barbara Catsambis, Sophia Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Mother's employment and children's achievement: A critique
organic_results.snippet: Recent research has concluded that mother's employment has a small but consistent negative effect on students' reading and mathematics achievement and that this effect is cumulative and proportional to mother's time spent working (Milne et al. 1986, this issue). This paper provides a conceptual and methodological critique of this research and an alternative analysis of the data. We find that respecifying the model to include measures of the structural, attitudinal, and socioeconomic determinants of mother's employment …

publication_info.summary: B Heyns, S Catsambis - Sociology of Education, 1986 - JSTOR
